sentence.Network_en: We don't know what will transpire when we have a new boss.
sentence.Network_cn: 当我们有位新老板时,不知会发生什麽.

sentence.Network_en: We do not know what may transpire when we have a new boss.
sentence.Network_cn: 当新老板来后,我们不知会有什么发生.

sentence.Network_en: All memorable events, I should say, transpire in morning time and in a morning atmosphere.
sentence.Network_cn: 我敢说, 所有值得回顾的事件, 都发生在清晨的光阴和气氛里.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 航海及海运专业词汇英语翻译(T) ... transpire 发散 transpire 蒸发 transplanetary space 行星外空间.
航海及海运专业词汇英语翻译(T) ... transparent 透明的 transpire 发散 transpire 蒸发.
英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... respiration n 呼吸 transpire v 泄露 dispirit v 使沮丧.
平流层臭氧层 - 豆丁网 ... throughflow n. (液体、气体等的)通流,直流 transpire vt. 使蒸发 utilization n. 利用.

list.abs: (二)蒸腾的途径(或部位) 2.叶片蒸腾 1)角质层蒸腾 (cuticular transpiration) 2)气孔蒸腾 (stomatal transpiraton) 可占蒸腾总量的80-90%。是中生和旱生植物.
...植物在一定时间内,单位叶面积上散失的水量称为蒸腾速率,又称蒸腾强度, 蒸腾比率,transpiration ratio,植物每消耗1kg水所生产干物质的克数,或者说,植物在一定时间内干物质的累积量与同期所消.
...1,通过角质层的蒸腾叫角质蒸腾,cuticular transpiration,2,通过气孔的蒸腾叫气孔蒸腾,stomatal transpiration,气孔蒸腾是植物叶片蒸腾的主要形式, 4度量常用的蒸腾作用的定量指标有.
...蒸腾系数蒸腾系数（transpiration coefficient）又称需水量（water requirement） ，指植物合成1克干物质所蒸腾消耗的水分克数。蒸腾系.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'emit as vapour through the surface'): from French transpirer or medieval Latin transpirare, from Latin trans- 'through' + spirare 'breathe'. Sense 1 (mid 18th cent.) is a figurative use comparable with ‘leak out’

entry.def: When it transpires that something is the case, people discover that it is the case.

example.ex: It transpired that Paolo had left his driving licence at home...
example.tran: 后来才知道保罗把驾照忘在家里了。

example.ex: As it transpired, the Labour government did not dare go against the pressures exerted by the City.
example.tran: 后来人们得知，工党政府不敢与伦敦金融界施加的压力相对抗。

entry.tran: 发生(有些讲英语的人认为该用法不正确)
entry.def: When something transpires, it happens. Some speakers of English consider this use to be incorrect.

example.ex: Nothing is known as yet about what transpired at the meeting.
example.tran: 会上到底发生了什么现在还没人知道。

means.word_mean: 1. pass through the tissue or substance or its pores or interstices, as of gas

sentences.sentence: "It transpired that she had worked as spy in East Germany"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 热心的,积极的,有抱负的
stems_affixes.word_buile: aspire[v.[to,after]渴望,追求,有志于]+ing表形容词→adj.热心的,积极的,有抱负的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 精神饱满的;生机勃勃的
stems_affixes.word_buile: spirit精神+ed……的→adj.精神饱满的;生机勃勃的
spirit精神+ual……的→adj.精神[上]的,心灵的
conspire[v.阴谋,同谋,谋叛]+acy表名词→n.阴谋,密谋,共谋
expire[v.期满,[期限]终止;呼气;断气,死亡]+ation表名词→n.期满,终止
inspire[v.鼓舞,激起;使产生灵感]+ation表名词→n.灵感;鼓舞,激励
spir呼吸,精神+it名词→n.精神;志气;[n.]情绪,心情;[n.]酒精
a加强+spir呼吸,精神+e→看到希望的东西加强呼吸→渴望,追求
dis去掉+pirit=spirit精神→去掉精神→使沮丧

stems_affixes.value_cn: 期满,[期限]终止;呼气;断气,死亡
stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出+pire=spir呼吸→有出气没进气→断气
in进入+spir呼吸,精神+e→吸气进去→引申为鼓励
per全部+spir呼吸+e→全身呼吸→出汗
trans改变,交流+spir呼吸,精神+e→互相呼吸→transpire泄漏

means.word_mean: (事实, 秘密等)被人知道, 泄露, 显露

sentences.en: It later transpired that he hadn’t been telling the truth.
sentences.cn: 他当时没说真话, 这在后来显露出来了。

sentences.en: Let’s wait and see what transpires.
sentences.cn: 我们等着瞧会发生什么事吧。
